Key Match Events: Rhys Hoskins socked a grand slam in the first inning to give the Brewers a 4-0 lead.
Manaea gave up six runs in 3 ²/₃ innings, his worst start of the second half.
Francisco Lindor reached base three times but the shortstop appeared unsteady and committed a throwing error.
The Brewers went 6-for-6 in stolen base attempts, including five with Francisco Alvarez behind the plate.
Francisco Alvarez took a called third strike on a full-count pitch that appeared to be below the strike zone, leading to his ejection.
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said, 'We didn’t give up.'
Sean Manaea said, 'We’re fighting for our lives over here and to do that, it doesn’t feel good, but we are resilient.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Francisco Alvarez left the game with back spasms.
Garrett Mitchell stole second for his 50th stolen base of the season.
The Mets were flat in all regards for a second straight game.
